question.title: What is the term for the abnormal facial nerve function often associated with parotid tumors?
question.description: A condition characterized by weakness or paralysis of the facial muscles, often resulting from damage to the facial nerve.

option_a.title: Facial paralysis
option_a.description: A condition characterized by weakness or paralysis of the facial muscles, often resulting from damage to the facial nerve.

option_b.title: Bell's palsy
option_b.description: A condition characterized by temporary weakness or paralysis of the facial muscles, often caused by inflammation of the facial nerve.

option_c.title: Trigeminal neuralgia
option_c.description: A condition characterized by sudden, severe pain in the face, often caused by compression or irritation of the trigeminal nerve.

option_d.title: Facial nerve palsy
option_d.description: A condition characterized by weakness or paralysis of the facial muscles, often resulting from damage to the facial nerve.

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The first letter of the correct answer
